data.title: Vintage in Whittier
data.text: Great little spot in Whittier.  Excellent food and very good drinks (cheap!!).  We loved a nice relaxing place with good service.

data.title: Yes, you can find great dining in Whittier!.
data.text: Great date night restaurant or just stop in for a wonderful Cocktail. Wonderful specials and the ambiance is beautiful and intimate.

data.title: Valentines dinner
data.text:
Don't usually venture out on Valentine's due to the crowds
Searched out and found Vintage and thought that we would give it a try
Glad that we did as we were not disappointed
Started with a shared wedge salad which had the perfect amount of dressing on it
My bride had a ribeye which was interesting as it was thin.
It was cooked perfectly
I had the sole and was impressed with how piping hot it came out
Desert was the Creme Brûlée which was wonderful
Lots of ambience with classic old music in the background at just the right level
Wife had a Moscow Mule which was perfect. She is not much of a drinker so she is fussy about her drinks. 
They have lots of options to choose from
Looking forward to going back to sample some of their martini options
Portions are not huge but ample
Nice find in Uptown Whittier

data.title: Very good food nice ambience
data.text:
Good food and desserts, did not drink but the wine and cocktail menu was extensive. Nice upscale atmosphere, great for a date night or special dinner. Bar area has tables for two for small plates, desserts and cocktails, I would definitely return for that.

Prices were a little high or I would have given it 5 stars. I had to settle for a dish I didn't really want because the good stuff was around $35/entrée and I wanted to add appetizers (pricey) and dessert ($9). It's pricey. If that doesn't bother you too much enjoy a great meal.

data.title: Great ambiance
data.text: Found a new spot for dinner.  Bar is  gorgeous. Great speciality drink election. Many signature drinks. Escargot is yummy. Beet salad is yummy.  Crab cakes are yummers. Great experience. Great service. Very attentive. Will definitely return. $15 corkage fee.  Good price. Hidden gem. Decor is nice and truly hidden.  Look for address the sign is very dim on the outside at night.

data.title: Dinner with friends, Bill and Ofelia
data.text: Well, we had a great time. Started with a split of excellent crab cakes, followed by Blue Cheese & Pear and a Wedge salads, We all had different entres...Chiliean Sea Bass Chicken Picata, Steam Mussels with Portabella Fries and Rib eye. We all raved about our selections. We paired individual glasses of wine, and Bill and I shared the Bread Pudding followed with an Expresso and Coffee. Chef & Owner, Mariaelena is a "Chef Extraordinaire."  We will definitely be back!. Thank You.

data.title: Great Drinks!!
data.text: Stopped in here late for some quick drinks and appetizers at the end of long work day. Took our order quickly and got the drinks out even quicker.

data.title: Birthday
data.text: We went to celebrate my birthday with my husband and my mom. It was my 1st time. Recommended by many of my friends. They were right. Food was excellent. Great portions. The desert,  out of this world!! Everything was amazing!  The spicy mango margarita was great!. We loved the way they made my day so special. Highly recommend this amazing place. The service is great.

data.title: Delicious Meal
data.text: Delicious meal from start to finish. I ordered the escargot and they were perfectly seasoned. Next came the filet mignon, medium rare and it melted in my mouth. The creme brûlée was the perfect ending to our meal. Be sure to order the spicy mango martini. They are out of this world!

data.title: Amazing filet
data.text: This little gem in Uptown Whittier doesn't look like much from the outside, but step in and the atmosphere is fun, the restaurant and bar provide a great dinner combination and the food is excellent in every way.  Love the French art, love that they have a full bar, which is not always the case in Whittier and love that they serve a varied menu that is scrumptous.  A must visit for a wonderful lunch or dinner.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text:
My wife and I took my mother-in-law to Vintage for her birthday.  My MIL is not a gourmet by any standard, but my wife and I enjoy fine dining.  We found Vintage online and after reading a few reviews, decided to go there.  Vintage is a long narrow restaurant, in uptown Whittier.  It is warm and charming, and would be great for a romantic meal - with one exception.  There is a TV over the bar, and it's visible from much of the restaurant.  It just seems a little out of place.

My MIL ordered the salmon with no appetizer and a glass of water, my wife ordered French onion soup, coq au vin and a glass of red wine, and I, a Caesar salad, wild mushroom ravioli and a pint of IPA.  

My wife's soup was dark and rich in flavor.  The broth looked to be beef based, rather than chicken, and while it was very good, a splash of sherry would have taken it to another level.  

I am pretty fussy about Caesar salads, and often order them to form a first opinion of a restaurant.  There are far too many restaurants which add non-traditional ingredients to their Caesar, leave a few out, or serve woefully inedible dressing with it.  Fortunately, Vintage's Caesar was excellent, and very traditional.  Their dressing was outstanding, and far better than any other I've had this year.

Our entress arrived, and my MIL seemed to enjoy her salmon very much.  The portion was the perfect size, and the veggies that it came with were perfectly cooked.  My wife's coq au van was served more deconstructed than traditional, yet it quite good and she really enjoyed it.  My ravioli were simply fantastic!  A good sized portion of ravioli in a lush sauce that was simply outstanding. 

As far as beverages, my wife's wine was perfectly good, but my IPA was just so-so.  There is no shortage of excellent brewers in southern California, so I think it's reasonable to expect great beer in an upscale restaurant.

We all shared two desserts - creme brulee and an apple tart.  Both were excellent, and the apple tart was exceptional.

To say we enjoyed this meal would be an understatement.  Most everything, except my beer, was very good to excellent.  

While I am not from Orange County, and have not dined at every restaurant in the area, I would certainly recommend Vintage Cafe to anyone looking for an outstanding meal.

data.title: not a french restaurant
data.text:
Went there last night.  When have you seen a French restaurant with a TV and showing a sports program..... totally ruined the overall ambiance.  Drinks are overpriced and bad.  Bartender uses a jigger and doesn't know how to fix dry martinis.  Food was fair.... had been there a few months back and had the sliders... ordered the sliders again and to my surprise, the number of sliders on the plate had been reduced to 2 from 3 and the meat used was ground meat instead of slided filet mignon as before, on top of that more expensive.
DEFINITELY DONOT RECOMMEND!

data.title: Very Pleasant Dining Experience
data.text: A mix of French and Italian menu, very tasy, though the food lacks inspiration.  Pleasant atmosphere, nice decore, good service.

data.title: Cute little gem!
data.text: Had spent hours on Greenleaf avenue on a Friday afternoon and when we thought we were done, we headed to the parking structure only to come upon this little French gem!  Ventured inside to be greeted by a lovely hostess and a shiny bar with stools and a wall lined with tables in front.  We sat in the corner in the front of the restaurant by the window.  It was very quaint with French inspired decor.  Has a blood orange cosmopoltan and a beer.  They had a happy hour.  Just tried a dessert, dried fruit and almond bread pudding.  Moist and flavorful.  Service was pleasant and attentive.  The place has a fun, cozy feel.  Giving it a 4 for the service and the atmosphere.

data.title: Great Find In Uptown Whittier...Great Food, Great Service!
data.text: Soooo glad I found this place...what a great find in Uptown. One of the best filets that I've ever had and Ive been to Ruth's Chris, BOA and other well known steak houses. It's definitely not a steakhouse, but a great little French style restaurant. From appetizers to dessert, it was all delicious. Service was awesome and our server was very polite and attentive.
